channel.title: Phone to pc?
channel.description:
Hey, I was looking at skype all excited, when I then realised you have to pay if you want to call people's phone. Now I only wanna make local calls using it, but here is the reason:
At my friends house, we put his phone on speaker phone(which I dont have), and we use a sound bord of dr. phil, and we phone people. We have like 1000 different things of docter phil talking, so you can imagine prank phone calls are hilarious. We are all at my house tonight wanting to do that some more, so anyways:
I have a microphone and everything, is there a way to call people using my microphone, and hear everything through my speakers(pc speakers)? And By that, I mean a free way of doing it? I used to have a program called mech warrior 3, and you can call people from it, except lately it doesnt work anymore and the window doesnt minimise anyways, so we cant use the sound bourd. I wish skype was free for calling phones So anyways, any ideas?

item.title: Phone to pc?
item.dc:creator: @noob noob
item.description:
@noob wrote:

Pwnd:

[quote author=blue_flame link=topic=369.msg4401#msg4401 date=1142743882]
How do you call someone using that? Because i wanted to call my cell phone and i put in the number and then i clicked dial and it said no dialtone.[br][size=1]Posted at: March 17, 2006, 11:00:56 pm[/size][hr]I have a modem. I read everything before i posted on some help.

You don't get dial tones with digital modems.[/quote]

Do you mean broadband modems?, i didnt know it had another name.

Read full topic

How do you call someone using that? Because i wanted to call my cell phone and i put in the number and then i clicked dial and it said no dialtone.[br][size=1]Posted at: March 17, 2006, 11:00:56 pm[/size][hr]I have a modem. I read everything before i posted on some help.

You don't get dial tones with digital modems.

Read full topic

item.title: Phone to pc?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Kk, This is what I do, Mujahead told me this:

First of all, I dont think you can use a broadband modem, however your computer should have an iternal modem inside. Look on the back of your pc for a phone jack. Hook a phone cord into your modem and into your wall. Go to Start>Run> and type in "Dialer" (without quotations). You should be able to phone people from that, you'll have to select some option to phone or modem(Forget what it says). Keep in mind, this is using your phone service, so dont make any long distance calls But all your phone calls will cewom through your pc speakers, I havn't tried using my microphone as a phone yet, but I have used my regular phone and it worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Phone to pc?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

noob:

[quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=369.msg4019#msg4019 date=1142619491]
yes, you can do it with things that come with windows, I believe you can do it just fine with start>programs>accessories>communication>HyperTerminal

You can only use it if you use old 56k modems... when i select tc/ip, i have to fill in some server, i dont gert it[/quote]

obviosly you have to have a modem, how are you trying to make calls without a modem?

Read full topic
